WRITING.TITLE: Help me make people kill themselves(in game)!
WRITING.TEXT: Hello there! I was recently inspired by /u/PedanticTweed's forced combo list and I wanted to make something slightly more morbid. I'm trying to put together a deck with the primary wincon's being giving people cards like [[Necropotence]] and then using [[Mindslaver]] to drain them to 0. I felt like going 5 color would be the best way to channel the jank and try making the deck happen. I don't expect this deck to be at all competitive nor do I really want it to be. I will probably proxy the whole thing before actually buying the pieces since the deck might end up being far too linear and boring over time, which makes budget a non-issue. So I came here for help straightening things out and seeing if there were things I missed since it was kind of difficult getting this far with such a strange and clunky strategy. The list is sitting at 95 cards, quite a few of which are just janky 5 color stuffs, so there is plenty of room for additions and cuts. I figured instead of jamming in 5 more random cards it would be better to just use suggestions. So please let me know what you guys think! I'd appreciate any and all input. **The list:** http://tappedout.net/mtg-decks/06-08-16-suicidal-tendencies/
Had to sneak that one in there. [[hive mind]] and the the pacts they can't pay for look like a hilarious way to take people out, good call!

I had previously just included the door because I thought it was hilarious in general, hadn't thought of donating it! I'm obligated to try and make that happen at some point, I'm sure my [[reaper king]] friend will love having that passed his way.
Interesting, that could be a cruel and hilarious way to accelerate a mana base, thanks!

That would be a hilarious match up, going to have to make that happen at some point. That ogre is perfect, just the sort of thing i knew i would miss when putting this together. I initially left impersonator off but it is too flexible to not include. thanks!
Chogath would be quite the experience.
Back in the day, especially when it comes from other twenty somethings.

Nekusar was one of the first decks I built and it got very linear for me, I ended up turning the deck into a [[crosis, the purger]] wheels and [[living death]] [[insurrection]] shenanigans, it's much more enjoyable for everyone and you get targeted less. Also has the added benefit of not being commander reliant, which is nice to have.

The proper choice is fries "light well". They come out golden and crispy just like ordering fries well done at any other burger place, where as in and out cooks their well done fries extra crunchy, go with the light well.

WRITING.TITLE: B/R Reanimator sideboard help for GP Seattle
WRITING.TEXT: I plan on taking Reanimator to Seattle next month and was curious what other people run or will be running. I'm fairly new to the deck but in testing at my local FNM's this list felt fairly solid. It's decidedly more proactive and light on hate pieces, what do you all think? https://tappedout.net/mtg-decks/19-03-18-JwL-br-reanimator/?cb=1521502326 Thanks in advance

Good advice, I considered going down one Griselbrand but wasn't sure if it was better to keep things as streamlined as possible pre-board. I play against a lot of lands and turbo depths in my local meta which has probably biased my opinion on the Magus but it has been an instant win every time. The match up is favored so it may very well be win more. Thanks for the input.

I've really like the lists that I've seen running Show on the side, and the idea of dropping the lootings is really interesting. What does your sideboard look like in terms of hate piece removal without the red? I feel like this is something I will try after the GP since I wont have much time to playtest this switch (I only play in paper for FNM usually).

First of all, thanks for the input. I'm glad to see you disagree with a number of my choices. I'm operating in quite a vacuum with this deck since none of my friends have experience with it and I'm the only one playing it at my LGS. So most of these choices have been from what feels good in my limited play time and looking at top8's/resources online. I was iffy on moving Tidespout side so I'll take your word for it and move it back main. The more I think about Iona in the places where I would bring in the Norn I agree here as well. I see a lot of lists not including Sire at all which really surprises me and could be a result of my limited experience. Putting Sire down as your early target often feels even more game ending than Griselbrand in a lot of matchups. For that same reason I feel like its great post board as Surgical bait since if it does stick its nearly always GG and if it doesn't you didn't have your reanimate targets ripped out. I like your recommendations on the disruption suites, this was one of the places where I feel the most inexperienced. The big reason why I'm not running Therapy is because of my limited meta knowledge. Obviously in a lot of match-ups you're naming what you don't want stopping you but in the rest you need more understanding of the appropriate hits. As I mentioned in the other reply the moons felt good against the Lands/Depths matchups but that could be win more. Went with the magus since it can be reanimated. Will heavily consider swapping them out. Archon was put in for Eldrazi, Show and Tell, Depths decks etc. Feels like a solid inclusion and a strong lock out against those decks. Considering I'm taking your advice on the disruption suite the duress' will probably be adjusted. Will probably be dropping Moons for a needle and trying a Firestorm.

I feel like Elesh is stronger against something like DnT, Elves, Delver/Pyromancer decks. While Arcon brings much better game against Eldrazi, Show and Tell, and Lands. Not really sure where I want to be on this one.

I see, and to make sure I've been siding properly the brutality's go in for the faithless looting's correct? Since they are replacing your discard outlet while going up on disruption to protect the combo. I may keep one magus on the side depending on how the list develops.

This is a sweet adaptation, the amount of variety in what could be considered a quite linear deck is really awesome. I'd love to give this a go but will probably wait until after the GP since the experience I have is with a traditional list. Excited to try all these variations out though.

Damn, thanks so much for the info! Thankfully I was in most of the right places in comparison to your advice but there were definitely a lot of situations I wasn't confident on and this will surely be a huge help.

Thanks for all the info, I've been altering the list as people have been making recommendations so it has become more reactive. I do agree with the mentality of keeping things in such a way that you're forcing all the questions as opposed to diluting for answers. So I'm not totally sure where I want to be in that regard, given the differences of opinions in just this thread it seems to be mostly preference. The unmask's in particular are really contentious for me since they're great protection but having 4 brutality for game 1 against DRS is equally as enticing. I'll probably be dropping the moon and adjusting for 2x macabre I've seen that primer and it has been a great help!

Love your work and would happily buy a playmat of your Stasis. I think it would be great to offer stitched edge playmats along the lines of what Peter Mohrbacher offers for some of his limited Angelarium work. The difference in quality is worth the cost as a consumer in my opinion and they'll last so much longer.
Their Facebook page kmcUS has a link to their web store, or you can just pull up the web store directly. I purchased through there and was very pleased with the sleeves.
My man!

Relatively straight forward proactive decks like these are great ways to get into the format. Asking questions as opposed to needing to have all the right answers makes the learning curve of the format feel much less steep. (Foolishly tried to start with D amp;T, immediately switched to BR reanimator myself)
I think they #8217;re making a reference to the CFB tournament decklist report that had this deck listed as MUD and half of the miracles decks listed as UW stoneblade

Black Dynamite.

ESH It was irresponsible of you and your very pregnant wife to get a puppy without being fully prepared to take care of it in addition to an infant. The fact that your wife is going back on the decision now because she #8217;s realizing just how much work a baby and a puppy can be shows how little thought went into the decision. I don #8217;t think you should be blamed for going back to work but it definitely doesn #8217;t help the situation. If you and your wife discuss it more and both think you #8217;re willing to try and make the puppy work you #8217;ll likely need to take it to a trainer so your wife doesn #8217;t get overwhelmed.
